Title: Energy Market – Analyst/Consultant - Renewables gases - Madrid
RoleDescription:
We are looking for great people to join our team of energy consultants. We are currently recruiting for our Madrid team, but we have regular opportunities in our other offices Bogota, Bangkok, Beijing, Berlin, Dubai, Dusseldorf, Helsinki, London, Oxford, Milan, New York, Oslo, Paris, Stockholm, Vienna, and Zurich.
The challenges of decarbonisation, decentralisation and digitalisation require us to continually challenge our existing ideas to remain at the forefront of thinking on the future of the energy industry. Our vision is to be the most recommended advisor for the energy transition. If you are as interested as we are in this dynamic industry, we would love to hear from you.
You will have the opportunity to gain knowledge and experience to become an industry specialist within a stimulating and supportive environment. Our team specialises in all aspects of the energy transition. We offer strategic and commercial advice, develop policy and regulations, model systems and markets and support transactions. We pride ourselves on our in-depth analysis and strong client relationships.
Often the work is office based but there are many opportunities to travel for shorter trips for client meetings or for entire projects where work is on the client site. With more than 800 consultants across over 20 offices on 5 continents, and supported by 19,000 experts at AFRY in design, engineering and digitalisation, we are driven by the idea of helping our clients find solutions to business-critical questions. For individuals looking for international experience we can also offer secondments to other offices.
As a primary responsibility, you will support AFRY consulting activities for a wide range of clients  including major financial investors, the largest Iberian and international utilities, government, and regulatory bodies  through projects carried out mainly in Spain, Portugal and Latin AmericaIf you are as interested as we are in this dynamic industry, we would love to hear from you.Below we explain the main skills that we look for in our Analysts/Consultants:A Masters degree, or higher, in maths, engineering, economics or science related subjectWorking experience of 1-3 years specialized in renewables gases with previous experience in the industry.Advanced analytical and quantitative skills. We undertake a lot of complex analysis, a good proportion of which is numerical, so we are looking for people with an aptitude for complex quantitative and qualitative analysis, statistics, manipulation of large data and diverse mathematical models. This includes the ability to pay attention to detail and use MS Excel proficiently, understanding programming logic, and creative problem-solving skills.Excellent team working and leadership. All the work we do requires team working and you will be responsible for the delivery of the whole team. This involves planning the work, supporting the team, anticipating challenges, leading by example, and accountability towards the client (with more Senior support when required).Being fluent in Spanish and English. On the one hand our clients are located in Spanish and non-Spanish speaking countries, and on the other hand our work requires day-to-day collaboration  in English  with other AFRY offices.Writing and communication skills. Report-writing and presenting in public is a core part of our work, therefore we are also looking for the ability to explain complex information in a clear and logical way in English, both in writing and orally.Proactivity and responsibility. You will be working in a commercial environment against budgets and deadlines so you will need to be able to think for yourself, be proactive and have a business-oriented mindset.Passion for energy markets and policies. You have a holistic understanding of European electricity or gas market dynamics, sustainability challenges, and energy policies.Proven hands-on experience of indicatively 1 to 3 years in:any energy field (e.g. trading, renewable energies, retail markets, networks etc.)any business practice (e.g. transactions, management consulting, engineering etc.)Additionally, we highly value:computer programming (e.g. Matlab, Visual Basic, VBA etc.)database skills (e.g. MS Access or MS SQL Server)knowledge of Portuguese, French or another European languagecontacts in your industryWe value a healthy work life balance and diversity. We can consider a range of flexible working arrangements. Please include your preferences in your application.In AFRY Management Consulting we offer a competitive salary, a performance related bonus scheme and an excellent range of benefits.As part of your online application process, please provide a CV and covering letter stating why you want to work for AFRY and your salary expectations. We only accept online applications.If we think you could be a good fit for the organization you will be invited for a telephone interview following which, if we are both happy to continue the process, you will then be invited to a face-to-face interview. To allow us to assess your skills in practice this will be accompanied by Excel, Word and analytical reasoning exercises. In addition, you will have an informal chat with members of the team to find out more about what it is like to work at AFRY.You must have a right to live and work in Spain.At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. Thats how we're making future.
